alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:42PM EST until February 08 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... White River from Edwardsport to Hazleton Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton East Fork White River at Seymour. Tippecanoe River near Delphi. Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is potential for flooding to develop later in the week at Vincennes and Mount Carmel. The crest is past Lafayette and should reach Covington by mid-morning Monday. The rives are rising at all locations. Flooding may last as long as Tuesday, February 6. Lowland flooding is either expected to develop or may develop on the lower White River by Monday night from about Edwardsport downstream to the Hazleton area. Flooding could last as long as Wednesday afternoon. Additional flooding is ongoing on the East Fork White at Seymour and tributaries of the upper Wabash. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 08... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site. * WHEN...Until Thursday, February 08. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, River cabins become isolated. Basement flooding begins in Hutsonville. Extensive agricultural flooding is in progress. Higher Illinois rural roads in eastern Clark and Crawford counties flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.2 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, February 07. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 1245 PM EST /1145 AM CST/.
